TunableTuple.name: _components
TunableTuple.description: The components that instances of this object should have.",

TunableVariant.name: state
TunableVariant.description: Allow persistent state to be saved for this object.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Allow persistent state to be saved for this object.

TunableVariant.name: delinquency_state_changes
TunableVariant.description: A tunable mapping linking a utility to a list of state changes to apply to the owning object of this component when that utility goes delinquent and is shut off.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: A tunable mapping linking a utility to a list of state changes to apply to the owning object of this component when that utility goes delinquent and is shut off.

TunableEnum.name: key
TunableEnum.description: A utility that will force state changes when it is shut off.

TunableList.name: value
TunableList.description: A tunable list of states to apply to the owning object of this component when the mapped utility is shut off.

TunableVariant.name: overlapping_slot_states
TunableVariant.description: A mapping of slots that this object can overlap with when parented to an object to the states that need to be applied when another object is in one of those slots. When another object is parented to one of the selected slots then this object will apply specific states. When an object is removed from an overlapping slot then this object will apply a different set of states.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: A set of slots mapped to a set of states for when an object is parented to an overlapping slot and what states to apply when there is or isn't an object in that slot.

TunableTuple.name: overlap data
TunableTuple.description: The state value to apply when another object is parented or removed from the parent object in the corresponding slot type.

Tunable.name: state_to_apply_on_deletion
Tunable.description: If an object was parented to an overlapping slot and that child is being deleted.

Tunable.name: state_to_apply_on_parent
Tunable.description: If an object is parented to a slot that overlaps with this object when it is parented to an object, then this is a reference to the states to apply to this object.

Tunable.name: state_to_apply_on_unparent
Tunable.description: If no object is parented to a slot that overlaps with this object when it is parented to an object, then this is a reference to the states to apply to this object.

Tunable.name: state_to_apply_on_unparent_by_sim
Tunable.display: State To Apply On Unparent By Sim
Tunable.description: If an object was parented to an overlapping slot and that child is unparented and the new parent is a sim then this is that state to apply.

Tunable.name: state_value_reference
Tunable.description: This is the state value that we will set to the states setup for when object are parented to overlapping slots.

TunableTuple.description: A structure that listens for state changes and applies state/statistic operations on the object when a certain combination of states are set.

TunableList.name: prohibited_states
TunableList.description: List of prohibited states. If the object has one of this state, it will not trigger the target state.

Tunable.description: Prohibited state.

TunableVariant.name: set_on_children
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, will apply states and/or stats to children of this object.

TunableTuple.name: set_on_children
TunableTuple.description: Lists of states and stats to apply to children.

TunableList.name: set_states
TunableList.description: List of States to set on children.

TunableList.name: statistic_ops
TunableList.description: List of statistic ops to apply to children.

TunableVariant.description: A statistic change operation to apply to all chilren of this object.

TunableTuple.name: statistic_add
TunableTuple.description: Attempt to add the specified statistic.

Tunable.name: stat
Tunable.description: The statistic we are operating on.

TunableVariant.name: text
TunableVariant.description:
Specify the display text to use for this tunable. This tuning structure may be shared across multiple tunables. It is up to the system consuming the tunable to determine in which ways the tuned display text is used.
e.g. Loot Operations The adventure system auto-generates notifications based on the loot that was awarded from a chance card. A loot's display text, if used, will be an item in the generated bulleted list. The ability to override display text allows tuners to set custom next in such notifications.
e.g. Reward Tuning Rewards have display text so that, similarly to adventures, a bulleted list of entries can be auto-generated when obtained by a Sim. Use this tunable to control the text of such entries.

Tunable.name: override
Tunable.description: Specify a string override. The tokens are different depending on the type of tunable.

TunableTuple.name: statistic_change
TunableTuple.description: Modify the value of a statistic.

Tunable.name: amount
Tunable.description: The one-time gain for this operation.

Tunable.name: exclusive_to_owning_si
Tunable.description: If enabled, this gain will be exclusive to the SI that created it and will not be allowed to occur if the sim is running mixers from a different SI. If disabled, this gain will happen as long as this SI is active, regardless of which SI owns the mixer the sim is currently running. This is only effective on Sims.

TunableVariant.name: maximum
TunableVariant.description: A variant containing the different ways you can cap the max amount a statistic reaches as result of a change.

TunableTuple.name: points
TunableTuple.description: The max amount of points that a stat can achieve after an increase.

Tunable.name: max_points
Tunable.description: The point total that a stat cannot go above when increasing. If the increase would go above this point total, instead it will just be equal to this point total.

TunableTuple.name: rank
TunableTuple.description: The max rank a stat can achieve after an increase.

Tunable.name: max_rank
Tunable.description:
The rank that a stat cannot go beyond when increasing. If the increase would go beyond achieving this rank, instead it will be set to the min points required to meet this rank. This will prevent any gains toward the next rank from occurring.
NOTE: Must be used with a RankedStatistic or it will return 0 as the max.

TunableVariant.name: object_cost_multiplier
TunableVariant.description: When enabled allows you to multiply the stat gain amount based on the value of the object specified.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: A construct that determines a multiplier based on the value/cost of an object.

TunableList.name: multiplier_curve
TunableList.description: The multiplier will be determined by interpolating against a curve. The value of the subject in simoleons is used. This means that a curve for cost should have value at its x-axis.

TunableTuple.description: Point on a Curve

Tunable.name: x
Tunable.description: x component

Tunable.name: y
Tunable.description: y component

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The object whose cost you want to base the multiplier on.

TunableEnum.name: periodic_change_behavior
TunableEnum.description:
When applying this change operation at the beginning of an interaction as part of a periodic statistic change and statistic is a continuous statistic, tune the behavior of this operation when interaction begins.
Terminology: BaseBehavior: For change operations that succeed chance and test or if chance is 100% or no tests, the statistic stores the start time and when interaction ends determine how much time is passed and multiply amount. Continuous statistic WILL NOT decay with this behavior. This is for better performance.
IntervalBehavior: If continuous statistic is using interval behavior. the amount tuned will be given at specified interval if chance and tests succeeds. Continuous statistics WILL decay between interval time.
Tuning Behavior APPLY_AT_START_ONLY: If chance and tests for change operation is successful, periodic update will occur and follow BaseBehavior. If either fail, change operation is not given at any point.
RETEST_ON_INTERVAL: If test and chance succeeds, then this will follow BaseBehavior. If test or chance fails, this operation will follow interval behavior.
APPLY_AT_INTERVAL_ONLY: This will strictly follow Interval Behavior.

Tunable.name: stat
Tunable.description: The statistic we are operating on.

TunableList.name: statistic_multipliers
TunableList.description:
Tunables for adding statistic based multipliers to the payout in the format:
amount *= statistic.value

TunableTuple.description: A construct that determines a multiplier based on a statistical value.

TunableVariant.name: multiplier
TunableVariant.description: Define how the multiplier will be applied.

TunableList.name: value_curve
TunableList.description: The multiplier will be determined by interpolating against a curve. The user-value is used. This means that a curve for skills should have levels as its x-axis.

TunableTuple.description: Point on a Curve

Tunable.name: x
Tunable.description: x component

Tunable.name: y
Tunable.description: y component

Tunable.name: statistic
Tunable.description: The payout amount will be multiplied by this statistic's value.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The participant to look for the specified statistic on.

TunableVariant.name: text
TunableVariant.description:
Specify the display text to use for this tunable. This tuning structure may be shared across multiple tunables. It is up to the system consuming the tunable to determine in which ways the tuned display text is used.
e.g. Loot Operations The adventure system auto-generates notifications based on the loot that was awarded from a chance card. A loot's display text, if used, will be an item in the generated bulleted list. The ability to override display text allows tuners to set custom next in such notifications.
e.g. Reward Tuning Rewards have display text so that, similarly to adventures, a bulleted list of entries can be auto-generated when obtained by a Sim. Use this tunable to control the text of such entries.

Tunable.description: The basic chance of success.

TunableEnum.name: transfer_type
TunableEnum.description: Type of statistic transfer to use.

TunableVariant.name: transfer_type_average_advanced
TunableVariant.description:
If enabled, the average calculation will be the sum of multiplying the stat value and stat quantity then dividing with total quantity. T = Transferred Stat value S = Stat value QT = Quantity Transferred Stat value QS = Quantity Stat value Result = ((T * QT) + (S * QS)) / (QT + QS)
If disabled, the result will calculate Mean of 2 stat values. Result = (T + S) / 2

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Statistic quantities for both subject and donor.

Tunable.name: quantity_stat
Tunable.description: Statistic quantity subject which will be applied to the average calculation.

Tunable.name: quantity_transferred_stat
Tunable.description: Statistic quantity donor which will be applied to the average calculation.

Tunable.name: transferred_stat
Tunable.description: The statistic whose value to transfer.

TunableVariant.name: set_random_state
TunableVariant.description: If enabled it will trigger a random state value out of the possible weighted list. This can be combined with set_state so either or both of them can apply on a state triggered. If a chance of nothing happening is desired you can tune an empty field on the trigger_random_state list.

TunableList.name: Trigger_random_state
TunableList.description: List of weighted states to be triggered.

TunableTuple.description: Pairs of states and weights to be randomly selected.

TunableList.name: tests
TunableList.description: A list of tests. All tests must succeed to pass the TestSet.

TunableVariant.description: A single tunable test.

TunableTuple.name: festival_running
TunableTuple.description: A test to check whether a festival is running.

TunableVariant.name: check_if_on_festival_street
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, test against if the player is on the festival's street.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: If checked, this test will pass only if the player is on the festival's street. If unchecked, the test will pass only if the player is not on the festival street.

TunableVariant.name: drama_node
TunableVariant.description: If enabled then we will check a specific type of festival drama node otherwise we will look at all of the festival drama nodes.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Reference to the festival drama node that we want to be running.

TunableVariant.name: festivals_to_check
TunableVariant.description: If enabled then we will only check a subset of all festival drama nodes referenced here. This will only apply if there is no specific drama node specified.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: A list of festival drama nodes that we want to check against.

Tunable.description: Reference to the festival drama node that we want to check against.

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: If enabled this test will pass if no festivals of the tuned requirements are running.

TunableTuple.name: valid_time_blocks
TunableTuple.description:
Festival drama nodes have a tunable pre-festival duration that delay festival start to some point after the drama node has started. For example, if the festival drama node has a pre-festival duration of 2 hours and the drama node runs at 8am, the festival will not start until 10am.
By default, this test passes if the festival drama node is running, regardless if the festival is in its pre-festival duration. This tuning changes that behavior.

Tunable.name: pre_festival
Tunable.description: If the festival is currently in its pre-festival duration, test can pass if this is checked and fails if unchecked.

Tunable.name: running
Tunable.description: If the festival is running (it is past its pre-festival duration), test can pass if this is checked and fails if unchecked.

TunableTuple.name: next_festival
TunableTuple.description: A test to check whether a festival is the next one.

TunableVariant.name: drama_node
TunableVariant.description: If enabled then we will check a specific type of festival drama node otherwise we will look at all of the festival drama nodes.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Reference to the festival drama node that we want to be the next one.

TunableVariant.name: festivals_to_check
TunableVariant.description: If enabled then we will only check a subset of all festival drama nodes referenced here.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: A list of festival drama nodes that we want to check against.

Tunable.description: Reference to the festival drama node that we want to check against.

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: If enabled this test will pass if the next festival is not one of the tuned nodes.

TunableTuple.name: object_criteria
TunableTuple.description: A test to look at all the objects and compare them to the tuned criteria.

Tunable.name: completed
Tunable.description: If checked, any craftable object (such as a painting) must be finished for it to be considered.

TunableVariant.name: desired_state_threshold
TunableVariant.description: A state threshold that the object must satisfy for this test to pass

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: A state threshold that the object must satisfy for this test to pass

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

TunableVariant.name: identity_test
TunableVariant.description: Which test to run on the object in order to determine if it matches or not.

Tunable.name: actual_object
Tunable.description: The object we want to test ownership of

TunableEnum.description: What tag to test for.

TunableEnum.name: test_type
TunableEnum.description: How to test the tags in the tag set against the objects on the lot.

Tunable.name: on_active_lot
Tunable.description: If checked, test whether or not the object is on the active lot. If unchecked the object can be either on the active lot or in the open streets area, we don't really care.

Tunable.name: owned
Tunable.description: If checked will test if the object is owned by the active household. If unchecked it doesn't matter who owns the object or if it is owned at all.

TunableVariant.name: positional_relationship_test
TunableVariant.description: The type of positional relationship test to run on the object with respect to another object.

TunableTuple.name: radius_test
TunableTuple.description: The object must be within a certain radius of a tuned participant in order for the test to pass.

Tunable.name: radius
Tunable.description: The radius, with the radius actor's position, that defines the area within which the object is valid.

TunableEnum.name: radius_actor
TunableEnum.description: The actor whose position, with the radius, defines the area within which the object is valid.

TunableTuple.name: tagged_object_on_same_level_test

TunableTuple.description: The object must has at least one object with a tuned tag on the same level as a tuned participant in order for the test to pass.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The participant to test against.

TunableEnum.name: tag
TunableEnum.description: A single tag to find an object matching to test against the participant.

TunableVariant.name: sim_ownership
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, test whether or not the object is owned by the active Sim. If checked, test will pass if the Sim owns the object.

TunableTuple.name: quantity
TunableTuple.description: The number of objects that meet the tuned critera needed to pass this test. quantity is run after a list of matching objects is created using the tuned criteria.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

TunableVariant.name: total_value
TunableVariant.description: If set, the total monetary value of all the objects that meet the tuned criteria needed in order to pass this test. total_value is run after a list of matching objects is created using the tuned criteria.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: If set, the total monetary value of all the objects that meet the tuned criteria needed in order to pass this test. total_value is run after a list of matching objects is created using the tuned criteria.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

TunableEnum.name: target
TunableEnum.description: If set this test will loop through the specified participants and run the object identity and criteria tests on them instead of all of the objects on the lot.

TunableList.name: test_events
TunableList.description:
The list of events that trigger this instance of the tuned test on.
If you pick ObjectStateChange, the test will be registered with EventManager for every ObjectStateValue managed by ObjectState controlling the desired_state_threshold. E.g. if the test cares about BrokenState_Broken, we will register tolisten for events for state changes of BrokenState_Broken, BrokenState_Unbroken, BrokenState_Repairing, etc.

Tunable.name: use_depreciated_values
Tunable.description: If checked, the value consideration for each checked object will at its depreciated amount. This affects the "All Objects" test type, changing the total value considered to be at the non-depreciated amount.

TunableVariant.name: value
TunableVariant.description: A threshold test for the monetary value of a single object in order for it to be considered.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: Value/comparison pair used to define a Threshold.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

TunableVariant.name: set_states
TunableVariant.description: If enabled it will trigger the states tuned on the list. Either this list or set random state needs to be tuned on a state trigger.

TunableList.name: Set_state_list
TunableList.description: List of states to be applied.

TunableList.name: statistic_operations
TunableList.description:
A list of statistic operations that will be applied when the trigger is thrown.
BEWARE: if a State being applied above is linked to a stat in this list, they may collide, and the statistic here will take precedent. Also, if a state this trigger is listening to is linked to a stat tuned here, then it's possible this will get in a circular loop forever. Please be smart about how you use this power.

TunableVariant.description: A statistic change operation.

TunableTuple.description: Attempt to add the specified statistic.

Tunable.name: stat
Tunable.description: The statistic we are operating on.

TunableVariant.name: text
TunableVariant.description:
Specify the display text to use for this tunable. This tuning structure may be shared across multiple tunables. It is up to the system consuming the tunable to determine in which ways the tuned display text is used.
e.g. Loot Operations The adventure system auto-generates notifications based on the loot that was awarded from a chance card. A loot's display text, if used, will be an item in the generated bulleted list. The ability to override display text allows tuners to set custom next in such notifications.
e.g. Reward Tuning Rewards have display text so that, similarly to adventures, a bulleted list of entries can be auto-generated when obtained by a Sim. Use this tunable to control the text of such entries.

Tunable.name: override
Tunable.description: Specify a string override. The tokens are different depending on the type of tunable.

TunableTuple.name: statistic_change
TunableTuple.description: Modify the value of a statistic.

Tunable.name: amount
Tunable.description: The one-time gain for this operation.

Tunable.name: exclusive_to_owning_si
Tunable.description: If enabled, this gain will be exclusive to the SI that created it and will not be allowed to occur if the sim is running mixers from a different SI. If disabled, this gain will happen as long as this SI is active, regardless of which SI owns the mixer the sim is currently running. This is only effective on Sims.

TunableVariant.name: maximum
TunableVariant.description: A variant containing the different ways you can cap the max amount a statistic reaches as result of a change.

TunableTuple.name: points
TunableTuple.description: The max amount of points that a stat can achieve after an increase.

Tunable.name: max_points
Tunable.description: The point total that a stat cannot go above when increasing. If the increase would go above this point total, instead it will just be equal to this point total.

TunableTuple.name: rank
TunableTuple.description: The max rank a stat can achieve after an increase.

Tunable.name: max_rank
Tunable.description:
The rank that a stat cannot go beyond when increasing. If the increase would go beyond achieving this rank, instead it will be set to the min points required to meet this rank. This will prevent any gains toward the next rank from occurring.
NOTE: Must be used with a RankedStatistic or it will return 0 as the max.

TunableVariant.name: object_cost_multiplier
TunableVariant.description: When enabled allows you to multiply the stat gain amount based on the value of the object specified.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: A construct that determines a multiplier based on the value/cost of an object.

TunableList.name: multiplier_curve
TunableList.description: The multiplier will be determined by interpolating against a curve. The value of the subject in simoleons is used. This means that a curve for cost should have value at its x-axis.

TunableTuple.description: Point on a Curve

Tunable.name: x
Tunable.description: x component

Tunable.name: y
Tunable.description: y component

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The object whose cost you want to base the multiplier on.

TunableEnum.name: periodic_change_behavior
TunableEnum.description:
When applying this change operation at the beginning of an interaction as part of a periodic statistic change and statistic is a continuous statistic, tune the behavior of this operation when interaction begins.
Terminology: BaseBehavior: For change operations that succeed chance and test or if chance is 100% or no tests, the statistic stores the start time and when interaction ends determine how much time is passed and multiply amount. Continuous statistic WILL NOT decay with this behavior. This is for better performance.
IntervalBehavior: If continuous statistic is using interval behavior. the amount tuned will be given at specified interval if chance and tests succeeds. Continuous statistics WILL decay between interval time.
Tuning Behavior APPLY_AT_START_ONLY: If chance and tests for change operation is successful, periodic update will occur and follow BaseBehavior. If either fail, change operation is not given at any point.
RETEST_ON_INTERVAL: If test and chance succeeds, then this will follow BaseBehavior. If test or chance fails, this operation will follow interval behavior.
APPLY_AT_INTERVAL_ONLY: This will strictly follow Interval Behavior.

Tunable.name: stat
Tunable.description: The statistic we are operating on.

TunableList.name: statistic_multipliers
TunableList.description:
Tunables for adding statistic based multipliers to the payout in the format:
amount *= statistic.value

TunableList.name: value_curve
TunableList.description: The multiplier will be determined by interpolating against a curve. The user-value is used. This means that a curve for skills should have levels as its x-axis.

TunableTuple.description: Point on a Curve

Specify the display text to use for this tunable. This tuning structure may be shared across multiple tunables. It is up to the system consuming the tunable to determine in which ways the tuned display text is used.
e.g. Loot Operations The adventure system auto-generates notifications based on the loot that was awarded from a chance card. A loot's display text, if used, will be an item in the generated bulleted list. The ability to override display text allows tuners to set custom next in such notifications.
e.g. Reward Tuning Rewards have display text so that, similarly to adventures, a bulleted list of entries can be auto-generated when obtained by a Sim. Use this tunable to control the text of such entries.

TunableVariant.name: transfer_type_average_advanced
TunableVariant.description:
If enabled, the average calculation will be the sum of multiplying the stat value and stat quantity then dividing with total quantity. T = Transferred Stat value S = Stat value QT = Quantity Transferred Stat value QS = Quantity Stat value Result = ((T * QT) + (S * QS)) / (QT + QS)
If disabled, the result will calculate Mean of 2 stat values. Result = (T + S) / 2

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Statistic quantities for both subject and donor.

Tunable.name: quantity_stat
Tunable.description: Statistic quantity subject which will be applied to the average calculation.

Tunable.name: quantity_transferred_stat
Tunable.description: Statistic quantity donor which will be applied to the average calculation.

Tunable.name: transferred_stat
Tunable.description: The statistic whose value to transfer.

TunableEnum.name: trigger_operation
TunableEnum.description: The operation to apply on the at_states to decide if we can trigger the at_state. AND: trigger the new state only if the object is in all the listed states at the same time. OR: trigger the new state if the object is in any of the listed states. NONE: trigger the new state only if the object is in none of the listed states.

Tunable.name: immediate_audio
Tunable.description:
If checked, this audio will be triggered immediately, nothing will block.
ex. Earbuds audio will be played immediately while the Sim is routing or animating.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The name of the slot this audio is attached to.

Tunable.name: play_on_active_sim_only
Tunable.description:
If enabled, and audio target is Sim, the audio will only be played on selected Sim. Otherwise it will be played regardless Sim is selected or not.
If audio target is Object, always set this to False. Otherwise the audio will never be played.
ex. This will be useful for Earbuds where we want to hear the music only when the Sim is selected.

TunableVariant.name: autonomy_modifiers
TunableVariant.description: A tunable to add custom statistic behavior when a state gets set. The autonomy modifier name will be maintained to match the existing tuning defined on autonomy which will allow to tune for statistic changes whenever a new state gets gets hit or added to an script object

TunableVariant.name: apply_new_value
TunableVariant.description: A tunable to add custom statistic behavior when a state gets set. The autonomy modifier name will be maintained to match the existing tuning defined on autonomy which will allow to tune for statistic changes whenever a new state gets gets hit or added to an script object

TunableTuple.name: apply_statistic_modifiers
TunableTuple.description: A tunable to add custom statistic behavior when a state gets set. The autonomy modifier name will be maintained to match the existing tuning defined on autonomy which will allow to tune for statistic changes whenever a new state gets gets hit or added to an script object

TunableList.name: autonomy_modifiers
TunableList.description: List of possible Modifiers that may happen when a statistic gets hit, this will modify the objects statistics behavior.

TunableTuple.description: An encapsulation of a modification to Sim behavior. These objects are passed to the autonomy system to affect things like scoring, which SI's are available, etc.

TunableList.name: commodities_to_add
TunableList.description: Commodites that are added while this autonomy modifier is active. These commodities are removed when the autonomy modifier is removed.

Tunable.name: commodities_value_persist_for_travel
Tunable.description:
If checked, value of commodities added from this modifier will persist through travel. This only works for commodities those have "Persisted Tuning" checked. Also please note commodities themselves won't persist, we record their value before travel and set the value back once arrived the destination.
If not checked, value of commodities added from this modifier will not persist through travel. Commodities will be re-added and start from their initial value.
Ex: Check this for Buff_Trait_Loner's autonomy modifier will make its attached Commodity_Trait_Loner_Solitude's value persist through travel. So when the sim arrives another lot, the commodity's value will be set back to that just before the travel, so its "Happy Loner" buff can persist as a consequence.

TunableList.name: decay_modifier_by_category

Tunable.description: Multiply statistic decay by this value.

TunableList.name: interaction_score_modifier
TunableList.description: A list of score modifications to interactions (specified by list, affordance or tags) to apply when the actor has this autonomy modifier.

TunableList.name: affordance_lists
TunableList.description: A list of affordance snippets that will be compared against.

Tunable.name: locked_stats_autosatisfy_on_unlock
Tunable.description: If true, locked stats will be set to the value on the auto satisfy curve when unlocked. If false they will remain as-is. (i.e. maxed)

TunableList.name: object_tags_that_override_off_lot_autonomy
TunableList.display: Object Tags That Override Off Lot Autonomy
TunableList.description: A list of object tags for objects that are always valid to be considered for autonomy regardless of their on-lot or off-lot status. Note that this will only override off-lot autonomy availability. It doesn't affect other ways that objects are culled out. For example, if an object list is passed into the autonomy request (like when we're looking at targets of a crafting phase), we only consider the objects in that list. This won't override that list.

TunableVariant.name: off_lot_autonomy_rule
TunableVariant.description:
The rules to apply for how autonomy handle on-lot and off-lot targets.
DEFAULT: Off-lot sims who are outside the lot's tolerance will not autonomously perform interactions on the lot. Sims will only autonomously perform off-lot interactions within their off-lot radius. ON_LOT_ONLY: Sims will only consider targets on the active lot. OFF_LOT_ONLY: Sims will only consider targets that are off the active lot. UNLIMITED: Sims will consider all objects regardless of on/off lot status. FESTIVAL: Sims will consider all objects within the festival area. ANCHORED: Sims will only consider objects within a tuned radius of autonomy anchor objects. Anchor objects can be objects that match a tag, sims that match a buff, or set by external systems.

TunableVariant.name: enabled
TunableVariant.description:
The rules to apply for how autonomy handle on-lot and off-lot targets.
DEFAULT: Off-lot sims who are outside the lot's tolerance will not autonomously perform interactions on the lot. Sims will only autonomously perform off-lot interactions within their off-lot radius. ON_LOT_ONLY: Sims will only consider targets on the active lot. OFF_LOT_ONLY: Sims will only consider targets that are off the active lot. UNLIMITED: Sims will consider all objects regardless of on/off lot status. FESTIVAL: Sims will consider all objects within the festival area. ANCHORED: Sims will only consider objects within a tuned radius of autonomy anchor objects. Anchor objects can be objects that match a tag, sims that match a buff, or set by external systems.

TunableTuple.name: anchored
TunableTuple.description: Sims will only consider targets that are off the active lot.

TunableVariant.name: anchor_buff
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this will set the autonomy anchor to all sims that match the tuned buff.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: The buff in question.

TunableVariant.name: buff_reason
TunableVariant.description: If set, specify a reason why the buff was added.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The reason the buff was added. This will be displayed in the buff tooltip.

Tunable.name: buff_type
Tunable.description: Buff that will get added to sim.

TunableVariant.name: anchor_tag
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this will set the autonomy anchor to all objects that match the tuned tag.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: The tag used to find an object to be an anchor.

Tunable.name: radius
Tunable.description:
The radius around the anchoring point in which the sim will consider objects. This point must be set on the autonomy component.
Designers: Please make sure this autonomy modifier is attached to a role or other other gameplay system that will correctly set the anchoring point before you set this. Or set the anchor tag on this tunable.

TunableTuple.name: default_behavior
TunableTuple.description: Off-lot sims who are outside the lot's tolerance will not autonomously perform interactions on the lot. Sims will only autonomously perform off-lot interactions within their off-lot radius.

Tunable.name: radius
Tunable.description: The radius around the sim in which he will consider off-lot objects. If it is 0, the Sim will not consider off-lot objects at all. This is not recommended since it will keep them from running any interactions unless they are already within the tolerance for that lot (set with Off Lot Tolerance).

Tunable.name: tolerance
Tunable.description: This is how many meters the Sim can be off of the lot while still being considered on the lot for the purposes of autonomy. For example, if this is set to 5, the sim can be 5 meters from the edge of the lot and still consider all the objects on the lot for autonomy. If the sim were to step 6 meters from the lot, the sim would be considered off the lot and would only score off-lot objects that are within the off lot radius.

TunableTuple.name: off_lot_only
TunableTuple.description: Sims will only consider targets that are off the active lot.

Tunable.name: radius
Tunable.description: The radius around the sim in which he will consider off-lot objects. If it is 0, the Sim will not consider off-lot objects at all. This is not recommended since it will keep them from running any interactions unless they are already within the tolerance for that lot (set with Off Lot Tolerance).

TunableTuple.name: on_lot_only
TunableTuple.description: Sims will only consider targets on the active lot.

TunableTuple.name: restricted
TunableTuple.description: Sims will consider all objects in the restricted open street autonomy area. This is defined by points in world builder so please make sure that world builder has setup the objects before trying to use this option.

TunableTuple.name: unlimited
TunableTuple.description: Sims will consider all objects regardless of on/off lot status.

TunableVariant.name: only_scored_static_commodities
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the sim in this role state will consider ONLY these static commodities when doing autonomy. EX: for walkbys, only consider the ringing the doorbell

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: List of statistics that will only be considered when doing autonomy.

TunableVariant.name: only_scored_stats
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the sim in this role state will consider ONLY these stats when doing autonomy. EX: for the maid, only score commodity_maidrole_clean so she doesn't consider doing things that she shouldn't care about.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: List of statistics that will only be considered when doing autonomy.

TunableVariant.name: outside_objects_multiplier
TunableVariant.description: When enabled, objects that are outside will have their interaction scores modified unless they are tagged with 'counts_as_inside'.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Amount to multiple the autonomy score by.

TunableVariant.name: override_convergence_value
TunableVariant.description: If enabled it will set a new convergence value to the tuned statistics. The decay of those statistics will start moving toward the new convergence value. Convergence value will apply as long as these modifier is active, when modifier is removed, convergence value will return to default tuned value. As a tuning restriction when this modifier gets removed we will reset the convergence to its original value. This means that we don't support two states at the same time overwriting convergence so we should'nt tune multiple convergence overrides on the same object.

TunableList.name: Set_new_convergence_value
TunableList.description: Mapping of statistic to new convergence value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: Value to which the statistic should convert to.

TunableVariant.name: provided_affordance_compatibility
TunableVariant.description: Tune this to provide suppression to certain affordances when an object has this autonomy modifier. EX: Tune this to exclude all on the buff for the maid to prevent other sims from trying to chat with the maid while the maid is doing her work. To tune if this restriction is for autonomy only, etc, see super_affordance_suppression_mode. Note: This suppression will also apply to the owning sim! So if you prevent people from autonomously interacting with the maid, you also prevent the maid from doing self interactions. To disable this, see suppress_self_affordances. (This may be tuned in place here using 'literal' or as a reference to a AffordanceFilter tuning snippet.)

TdescFragTag.name: literal
TdescFragTag.description: An affordance filter.

Tunable.name: reference
Tunable.description: A reference to a AffordanceFilter tuning snippet.

TunableList.name: relationship_score_multiplier_with_buff_on_target
TunableList.display: Relationship Score Multiplier With Buff On Target
TunableList.description:
Mapping of buffs to multipliers. The buff must exist on the TARGET sim. If it does, this value will be multiplied into the relationship score.
Example: The make children desire to socialize with children, you can add this autonomy modifier to the child's age buff. You can then map it with a key to the child buff to apply a positive multiplier. An alternative would be to create a mapping to every other age and apply a multiplier that is smaller than 1.

Tunable.description: The buff that the target sim must have to apply this multiplier.

Tunable.name: value

TunableList.name: stat_use_multiplier
TunableList.description: List of stats and multiplier to affect their increase-decrease. All stats on this list whenever they get modified (e. by a constant modifier on an interaction, an interaction result...) will apply the multiplier to their modified values. e. A toilet can get a multiplier to decrease the repair rate when its used, for this we would tune the commodity brokenness and the multiplier 0.5 (to decrease its effect) This tunable multiplier will affect the object statistics not the ones for the sims interacting with it.

Tunable.name: key
Tunable.description: The stat the multiplier will apply to.

TunableTuple.name: value
TunableTuple.description: Float value to apply to the statistic whenever its affected. Greater than 1.0 if you want to increase. Less than 1.0 if you want a decrease (>0.0). A value of 0 is considered invalid and is skipped.

TunableEnum.name: apply_direction
TunableEnum.description: Direction on when the multiplier should work on the statistic. For example a decrease on an object brokenness rate, should not increase the time it takes to repair it.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: Float value to apply to the statistic whenever its affected. Greater than 1.0 if you want to increase. Less than 1.0 if you want a decrease (>0.0). A value of 0 is considered invalid and is skipped.

TunableList.name: static_commodity_score_multipliers
TunableList.description: Mapping of statistics to multipliers values to the autonomy scores. EX: giving motive_bladder a multiplier value of 2 will make it so that that motive_bladder is scored twice as high as it normally would be.

Tunable.name: key
Tunable.description: The static commodity the multiplier will apply to.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The autonomy score multiplier for the static commodity. Multiplies autonomy scores by the tuned value.

TunableVariant.name: subject
TunableVariant.description: Specifies to whom this autonomy modifier will apply. - Apply to owner: Will apply the modifiers to the object or sim who is triggering the modifier. e.g Buff will apply the modifiers to the sim when he gets the buff. An object will apply the modifiers to itself when it hits a state. - Apply to interaction participant: Will save the modifiers to be only triggered when the object/sim who holds the modifier is on an interaction. When the interaction starts the the subject tuned will get the modifiers during the duration of the interaction. e.g A sim with modifiers to apply on an object will only trigger when the sim is interactin with an object.

TunableVariant.name: apply_on_interaction_to_participant
TunableVariant.description: Subject on which the modifiers should apply. When this is set it will mean that the autonomy modifiers will trigger on a subect different than the object where they have been added. e.g. a shower ill have hygiene modifiers that have to affect the Sim

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: Subject on which the modifiers should apply. When this is set it will mean that the autonomy modifiers will trigger on a subect different than the object where they have been added. e.g. a shower ill have hygiene modifiers that have to affect the Sim

Tunable.name: super_affordance_suppress_on_add
Tunable.description: If checked, then the suppression rules will be applied when the modifier is added, potentially canceling interactions the owner is running.

TunableEnum.name: super_affordance_suppression_mode
TunableEnum.description: Setting this defines how to apply the settings tuned in Super Affordance Compatibility.

Tunable.name: suppress_preroll_autonomy
Tunable.description: If checked, sims with this buff will not run preroll autonomy when first loading into a lot. This means that when the loading screen disappears, they will be standing exactly where they spawned, looking like a chump, instead of being somewhere on the lot doing a normal-looking activity. As soon as the loading screen disappears, all bets are off and autonomy will run normally again.

Tunable.name: suppress_self_affordances
Tunable.description:
If checked, the super affordance compatibility tuned for this autonomy modifier will also apply to the sim performing self interactions.
If not checked, we will not do provided_affordance_compatibility checks if the target of the interaction is the same as the actor.
Ex: Tune the maid's provided_affordance_compatibility to exclude all so that other sims will not chat with the maid. But disable suppress_self_affordances so that the maid can still perform interactions on herself (such as her No More Work interaction that tells her she's finished cleaning).

TunableVariant.name: supress_outside_objects_if_sun_out
TunableVariant.display: Supress Outside Objects If Sun Out
TunableVariant.description: When enabled, objects on the outside will be suppressed by autonomy if the sun is out (i.e. region provides light, it's daytime, and weather isn't too cloudy) and will not be used unless they have interactions tagged with 'counts_as_inside'.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: When checked, outside objects will be suppressed, otherwise supression will be canceled. Canceling suppression will have a higher priority than an active supression, this is to support cases like vampire buffs always being suppressed, but when they activate the daywalker power, that cancelation of suppression should always have a higher priority.

Tunable.description:
The multiplier to apply to the autonomous interaction score as a result of the Sim transitioning from sit to something else.
This number should be less than one (<1) in order for it to be a penalty, otherwise it will be a bonus.

TunableTuple.name: periodic_statistic_change
TunableTuple.description: The stat change apply on the target within the state value.

Tunable.name: interval
Tunable.description: The number of sim minutes in between each application of the tuned operations. Note: This operation sets an alarm, which has performance implications, so please see a GPE before setting to a number lower than 5 mins.

Tunable.name: amount
Tunable.description: The one-time gain for this operation.

TunableVariant.name: maximum

Tunable.description: The point total that a stat cannot go above when increasing. If the increase would go above this point total, instead it will just be equal to this point total.

Tunable.name: max_rank
Tunable.description:
The rank that a stat cannot go beyond when increasing. If the increase would go beyond achieving this rank, instead it will be set to the min points required to meet this rank. This will prevent any gains toward the next rank from occurring.
NOTE: Must be used with a RankedStatistic or it will return 0 as the max.

TunableVariant.name: object_cost_multiplier
TunableVariant.description: When enabled allows you to multiply the stat gain amount based on the value of the object specified.

TunableTuple.description: A construct that determines a multiplier based on the value/cost of an object.

TunableList.name: multiplier_curve
TunableList.description: The multiplier will be determined by interpolating against a curve. The value of the subject in simoleons is used. This means that a curve for cost should have value at its x-axis.

TunableTuple.description: Point on a Curve

Tunable.name: x
Tunable.description: x component

Tunable.name: y
Tunable.description: y component

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The object whose cost you want to base the multiplier on.

TunableEnum.name: periodic_change_behavior
TunableEnum.description:
When applying this change operation at the beginning of an interaction as part of a periodic statistic change and statistic is a continuous statistic, tune the behavior of this operation when interaction begins.
Terminology: BaseBehavior: For change operations that succeed chance and test or if chance is 100% or no tests, the statistic stores the start time and when interaction ends determine how much time is passed and multiply amount. Continuous statistic WILL NOT decay with this behavior. This is for better performance.
IntervalBehavior: If continuous statistic is using interval behavior. the amount tuned will be given at specified interval if chance and tests succeeds. Continuous statistics WILL decay between interval time.
Tuning Behavior APPLY_AT_START_ONLY: If chance and tests for change operation is successful, periodic update will occur and follow BaseBehavior. If either fail, change operation is not given at any point.
RETEST_ON_INTERVAL: If test and chance succeeds, then this will follow BaseBehavior. If test or chance fails, this operation will follow interval behavior.
APPLY_AT_INTERVAL_ONLY: This will strictly follow Interval Behavior.

Tunable.name: stat
Tunable.description: The statistic we are operating on.

TunableList.name: statistic_multipliers
TunableList.description:
Tunables for adding statistic based multipliers to the payout in the format:
amount *= statistic.value

TunableList.description: The multiplier will be determined by interpolating against a curve. The user-value is used. This means that a curve for skills should have levels as its x-axis.

TunableTuple.description: Point on a Curve

Tunable.name: x
Tunable.description: x component

Tunable.name: y
Tunable.description: y component

Tunable.name: statistic
Tunable.description: The payout amount will be multiplied by this statistic's value.

TunableEnum.name: subject

TunableVariant.name: text
TunableVariant.description:
Specify the display text to use for this tunable. This tuning structure may be shared across multiple tunables. It is up to the system consuming the tunable to determine in which ways the tuned display text is used.
e.g. Loot Operations The adventure system auto-generates notifications based on the loot that was awarded from a chance card. A loot's display text, if used, will be an item in the generated bulleted list. The ability to override display text allows tuners to set custom next in such notifications.
e.g. Reward Tuning Rewards have display text so that, similarly to adventures, a bulleted list of entries can be auto-generated when obtained by a Sim. Use this tunable to control the text of such entries.

Tunable.name: override
Tunable.description: Specify a string override. The tokens are different depending on the type of tunable.

TunableVariant.name: awareness

TunableList.description: A list of broadcasters to request.

Tunable.name: stop_processing

A list of tests groups. At least one must pass all its sub- tests to pass the TestSet.
ORs of ANDs

TunableVariant.name: change_value
TunableVariant.description: Operation to change the current value of the target object and potenitally add that value to the running total of insurance owed.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Operation to change the current value of the target object and potenitally add that value to the running total of insurance owed.

Tunable.name: change_percentage
Tunable.description: A percentage of the catalog value to modify the current value of the target. It will either decrease or increase the value of the object based on the setting of reduce_value.

Tunable.name: covered_by_insurance
Tunable.description:
If checked it means that the user will be awarded an insurance payment for the value lost. Currently this only happens with fire insurance and there is seperate tuning in the fire service for how much of the reduction is awarded as part of the insurance.
NOTE: There is a tunable percent of the value that get's tuned here that actually gets added to the insurance tally. That tuning exists on services.fire_service. The name of the tunable is Fire Insurance Claim Percentage.

Tunable.name: apply_depreciation
Tunable.description:
Whether or not to apply initial depreciation when this value change is applied.
Example: if you are replacing an object that is burned we want to make the value worth the full value of the object again, but you also need to apply the initial depreciation as if it was purchased from buy mode.

Modifiers for this object's Environment Score based on it's Client State.
Example: Broken objects should emit a negative environment score and should have an added negative modifier.
Example: Blooming Flowers should emit a positive emotion when they are blooming

Each trait can put modifiers on any number of moods as well as the negative environment scoring.
Example: Neat trait could set the negative score multiplier to 2 for spoiled/dirty/broken objects.
Example: For a dirty object, a Sim with the Slob trait could set the negative score multiplier to 0, and even set the happy mood to +2.

TunableList.name: mood_modifiers

Tunable.name: multiply_modifier

TunableEnum.name: periodic_change_behavior
TunableEnum.description:
When applying this change operation at the beginning of an interaction as part of a periodic statistic change and statistic is a continuous statistic, tune the behavior of this operation when interaction begins.
Terminology: BaseBehavior: For change operations that succeed chance and test or if chance is 100% or no tests, the statistic stores the start time and when interaction ends determine how much time is passed and multiply amount. Continuous statistic WILL NOT decay with this behavior. This is for better performance.
IntervalBehavior: If continuous statistic is using interval behavior. the amount tuned will be given at specified interval if chance and tests succeeds. Continuous statistics WILL decay between interval time.
Tuning Behavior APPLY_AT_START_ONLY: If chance and tests for change operation is successful, periodic update will occur and follow BaseBehavior. If either fail, change operation is not given at any point.
RETEST_ON_INTERVAL: If test and chance succeeds, then this will follow BaseBehavior. If test or chance fails, this operation will follow interval behavior.
APPLY_AT_INTERVAL_ONLY: This will strictly follow Interval Behavior.

TunableVariant.name: text
TunableVariant.description:
Specify the display text to use for this tunable. This tuning structure may be shared across multiple tunables. It is up to the system consuming the tunable to determine in which ways the tuned display text is used.
e.g. Loot Operations The adventure system auto-generates notifications based on the loot that was awarded from a chance card. A loot's display text, if used, will be an item in the generated bulleted list. The ability to override display text allows tuners to set custom next in such notifications.
e.g. Reward Tuning Rewards have display text so that, similarly to adventures, a bulleted list of entries can be auto-generated when obtained by a Sim. Use this tunable to control the text of such entries.

TunableVariant.name: periodic_loot
TunableVariant.description:
Periodic loot operation. Every tuned number of Sim minutes, the specified periodic loots will be applied.
NOTE: The recurring alarm that awards loots is not persisted! The initial delay will always be used when loading.
If timing persistence is important, and you are so inclined to do so, do not use this functionally and opt instead to tune loots that are awarded on commodity states, knowing the additional overhead of tuning and managing the commodity that controls them.

Tunable.description: The name of the slot this effect is attached to.

Tunable.name: play_immediate
Tunable.description:
If checked, this effect will be triggered immediately, nothing will block.
ex. VFX will be played immediately while the Sim is routing or animating.

TunableVariant.name: vfx_state_state
TunableVariant.description: Define a visual effect state on any visual effects controlled by this state.

TunableTuple.name: apply_new_value
TunableTuple.description: For a Visual Effect that is playing due to the associated state, set the VFX state as defined in the Swarm file.

Tunable.name: state_index
Tunable.description: The index of the state to apply to the VFX activated by the state that is also activating this state change. This is defined in the Swarm file.

TunableVariant.name: state_owning_vfx
TunableVariant.description: Specify which client states the VFX that we care about are owned by.

TunableList.name: Use_Specific_State
TunableList.description: Specify specific state(s) that own VFX.

Tunable.description: The client state(s) owning the VFX we want to modify.

TunableVariant.name: video_playlist
TunableVariant.description: List of clip names and append behavior.

TunableVariant.name: apply_new_value
TunableVariant.description: List of clip names and append behavior.

TunableTuple.name: start_video
TunableTuple.description: List of clip names and append behavior.

Tunable.name: append_clip
Tunable.description: If enabled clip list will be appended to previous playing clip instead of interrupting the existing playlist. This should be tuned when the clips should have a smoother transition like a credits scene on a movie.

Tunable.name: loop_last
Tunable.description: If enabled, the clip will loop. Otherwise, it's played once and stop on last frame.

TunableVariant.name: visibility
TunableVariant.description: A visibility state to apply

TunableTuple.name: apply_new_value
TunableTuple.description: A visibility state to apply

Tunable.name: enable_drop_shadow
Tunable.description: If True, this object's drop shadow may be visible. If False, this object's drop shadow will not be visible.

Tunable.name: inherits
Tunable.description: If True, this object can only be visible if its parent is visible. If False, it may be visible regardless of its parent's visibility.

Tunable.name: visibility
Tunable.description: If True, the object may be visible. If False, the object will not be visible.

TunableVariant.name: visibility_flags
TunableVariant.description: If specified, apply visibility flag overrides for this object. For example, control whether or not the object is reflected in mirrors and water.

TunableVariant.name: voice_actor
TunableVariant.description: A State Change Operation Tunable that sets voice actor for an object.

TunableTuple.name: apply_new_value
TunableTuple.description: A State Change Operation Tunable that sets voice actor for an object.

TunableVariant.name: voice_actor_override
TunableVariant.description: We can override an object's voice actor. This will be sent to Client, then when audio request the actor suffix, we check for this override on the object. If "No Override" is chosen, existing override will be removed.

TunableVariant.name: walkstyle
TunableVariant.description: Request a walkstyle on a particular Sim. Walkstyles with higher priorities trump walkstyles with lower priorities.

TunableVariant.name: apply_new_value
TunableVariant.description: Request a walkstyle on a particular Sim. Walkstyles with higher priorities trump walkstyles with lower priorities.

TunableTuple.name: request_walkstyle
TunableTuple.description: Request a walkstyle on a particular Sim. Walkstyles with higher priorities trump walkstyles with lower priorities.

TunableEnum.name: priority
TunableEnum.description: The priority of the walkstyle. Higher priority walkstyles will take precedence over lower priority. Equal priority will favor recent requests.

Tunable.name: walkstyle
Tunable.description: The locomotion resource (i.e. walkstyle) to request. Depending on the tuned priority and other requests active on the Sim, this may or may not apply immediately.

TunableVariant.name: wind_speed_level
TunableVariant.description: A State Change Operation Tunable to change an object's speed. [Supported only wind turbine currently.]

TunableTuple.name: apply_new_value
TunableTuple.description: A State Change Operation Tunable to change an object's speed. [Supported only wind turbine currently.]

TunableVariant.name: spin_speed
TunableVariant.description: The spin speed level to set for the sim. The locked float are fixed enums on the client.

Tunable.name: transition_speed
Tunable.description: Set the transition speed of the object. The transition speed defines the speed of the transition between spin speeds.

TunableVariant.name: default_value
TunableVariant.description: The default value for the state.

TunableList.name: random
TunableList.description: A weighted list of object states to randomly choose between as the default for this state.

Tunable.name: reset_on_load_if_time_passes
Tunable.display: Reset On Load If Time Passes
Tunable.description: If checked then the object is saved with the default state rather than the current state. If we want it to return to this state we need an interaction that is saved to put it back into it.

Tunable.name: reset_to_default
Tunable.description: If checked, when the object is reset, the state will be reset to the default value. Otherwise, it will keep the current value.

TunableVariant.name: tested_states_on_add
TunableVariant.description: The first test that passes will have its state applied. If no tests pass, the fallback state will be applied. This can be used to conditionally apply a state to an object. For example, the Tree Rabbit Hale needs to default to the open state when it's on the Slyvan Glade venue. This runs when the object is added to the world.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Test based states. The first test that passes will have its state applied. If all tests fail, the fallback state will be applied. These are applied in def on_add of the state component.

TunableVariant.name: fallback_state
TunableVariant.description: If all tests fail, this state will be applied.

TunableList.name: tested_states
TunableList.description: The first test that passes will have its state applied.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description:
A list of tests groups. At least one must pass all its sub- tests to pass the TestSet.
ORs of ANDs

TunableVariant.name: tested_states_on_location_changed
TunableVariant.description: The first test that passes will have its state applied. If no tests pass, the fallback state will be applied. This can be used to conditionally apply a state to an object. For example, the boat needs to be set to it's on water state if it is placed on water. This runs when the location of the object changes as long as the object isn't currently routing.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Test based states. The first test that passes will have its state applied. If all tests fail, the fallback state will be applied. These are applied in def on_add of the state component.

TunableVariant.name: fallback_state
TunableVariant.description: If all tests fail, this state will be applied.

TunableList.name: tested_states
TunableList.description: The first test that passes will have its state applied.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description:
A list of tests groups. At least one must pass all its sub- tests to pass the TestSet.
ORs of ANDs

TunableVariant.name: timed_state_triggers
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, when states in this key mapping get triggered, it will trigger states changes at each of the tuned intervals.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: Map of state when the timed state triggers will be active and the states to trigger, specific trigger times, and the options of whether to trigger on load.

TunableList.name: ops
TunableList.description: List of multiple states and times when they can be triggered.

TunableTuple.description: Pair of trigger time and states to trigger when the time has passed.

TunableList.name: loot_list
TunableList.description: A list of loot operations to apply when state change is triggered.

TunableList.name: states_to_trigger
TunableList.description: List of states to trigger.

Tunable.name: trigger_time
Tunable.description: The time when the state to trigger will be enabled.

Tunable.name: trigger_on_load
Tunable.description: If set to True, when the state in the key mapping is set on an object on load the changes are triggered.

TunableVariant.name: unique_state_changes
TunableVariant.description: Special cases that will cause state changes to occur.

Tunable.name: enter_carry_state
Tunable.description: If specified, the object will enter this state when entering carry.

Tunable.name: exit_carry_state
Tunable.description: If specified, the object will enter this state when exiting carry.

Tunable.name: inside_placement_state
Tunable.description: If specified, the object will enter this state when being placed inside.

Tunable.name: off_natural_ground_placement_state
Tunable.description: If specified, the object will enter this state when being placed off of natural ground.

Tunable.name: on_natural_ground_placement_state
Tunable.description: If specified, the object will enter this state when being placed on natural ground.

Tunable.name: outside_placement_state
Tunable.description: If specified, the object will enter this state when being placed outside.

TunableList.name: slot_placement
TunableList.description: A list of state changes which will be applied, if their tests pass, when this object is slotted to another object. In these tests, Actor is this object and Target/Object is the parent object.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description:
A list of tests groups. At least one must pass all its sub- tests to pass the TestSet.
ORs of ANDs

TunableList.name: slot_removal
TunableList.description: A list of state changes which will be applied, if their tests pass, when this object is removed from a slot on another object. In these tests, Actor is this object and Target/Object is the parent object.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description:
A list of tests groups. At least one must pass all its sub- tests to pass the TestSet.
ORs of ANDs

TunableList.name: surface_type_placement_states
TunableList.description: Mapping of surface type to the state that should be enabled when an object is placed on that type of surface. State will not be removed if object is off that surface, to do this the other options on the surface types should be tuned. i.e. Pet Ball should IDLE when placed on POOL routing surface, but should be on state OFF when placed on WORLD or OBJECT surfaces.

TunableEnum.name: key
TunableEnum.description: The surface type that will trigger the state change.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: State to trigger when the object is placed on the specified surface type.

Tunable.name: adjust_sim_positions_dynamically
Tunable.description: Whether this group should attempt to shift Sims around to maximize placement quality.

Tunable.name: disallow_reaction_mixers
Tunable.description: If checked, Sims in this social group will be disallowed from running mixer reactions.

TunableTuple.name: facing_restriction
TunableTuple.description:
Controls how a Sim must face the center of a social group.
If the range is less than 360, a Sim will be prohibited from socializing if they face away from the center. Because mobile Sims can change their facing, this will mostly affect Sims who are socializing while in objects.

Tunable.name: inner_radius
Tunable.description: A radius around the center of the constraint that defines an area in which the Sim's facing is unrestricted.

Tunable.name: range
Tunable.description: The size of the angle-range that sims should use when determining facing constraints.

TunableVariant.name: subroot_index
TunableVariant.description: An optional subroot to use for facing.

TunableVariant.name: group_leader
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, you can tune the sim participant who will be the leader of this social group. If the leader leaves the group the group will be shutdown.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: The leader of the social group.

Tunable.name: include_default_facing_constraint
Tunable.description: If enabled, the default Facing constraint will be included in interactions using this group.

Tunable.name: is_side_group
Tunable.description: If checked, this group represents the sub-set of the sims inside the main social group. It will bring some different social adjustment behavior for sims in the side group.

Tunable.name: is_visible
Tunable.description: If set, then Sims in this group will have a visible representation in the UI, i.e. a Relationship Inspector will be available and Groupobobs will appear.

TunableVariant.name: line_of_sight
TunableVariant.description:
A line_of_sight constraint represents an area viewable from a point, so it adapts itself to respect the wall graph. Sims attempting to interact with a group will need to be within this constraint in order to do so.
Example: The television has line_of_sight tuned on it. When Sims try to use the television, they will try to route to within the line_of_sight constraint to watch it. This ensures that Sims cannot watch the television from too far away or through walls.
There are some valid cases where you'd want this disabled, but be aware that doing so will mean Sims can potentially be in this group and interact with each other through walls. In the case of something like the "cellDoor" group, we know that any interaction using that group will have the relevant Sims in a specific posture relative to the same object and a LOS constraint is not needed.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: The line of sight for this social group.

Tunable.name: facing_offset
Tunable.description: The LOS origin is offset from the object origin by this amount (mainly to avoid intersecting walls).

TunableTuple.name: line_of_sight
TunableTuple.description: The Line of Sight constraint.

Tunable.name: boundary_epsilon
Tunable.description: The LOS origin is allowed to be outside of the boundary by this amount.

Tunable.name: map_divisions
Tunable.description: " The number of points around the object to check collision from. More points means higher accuracy.

Tunable.name: max_line_of_sight_radius
Tunable.description: The maximum possible distance from this object than an interaction can reach.

Tunable.name: simplification_ratio
Tunable.description: A factor determining how much to combine edges in the line of sight polygon.

Tunable.name: max_distance_to_snap_to_cluster_sq
Tunable.display: Max Distance To Snap To Cluster Sq
Tunable.description: The maximum distance (in meters) a group constraint will move to snap to a cluster.

Tunable.name: max_radius
Tunable.description: The maximum radius of this social group

Tunable.name: maximum_sim_count
Tunable.description: The maximum number of Sims in this social group.

Tunable.name: minimum_sim_count
Tunable.description: The minimum number of Sims in this social group; if fewer Sims are in the group it will be destroyed.

Tunable.name: radius_scale
Tunable.description:
Determines the baseline radius of the social group.
The ideal social group radius increases as the number of Sims increases, based on the formula: radius_scale * sqrt(num_sims / 2).
So if there are two Sims, the ideal group will be exactly this size, and if there are four Sims, it will be 1.4142 * radius_scale.

TunableVariant.name: social_anchor_object
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, you can tune a participant to be the anchor the social group is constructed around. Game groups tune the anchor to the object the game targets. If disabled, the group_leader, if tuned, will be the anchor.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: The anchor the social group forms around.

Tunable.name: time_until_posture_changes
Tunable.description: The length of time a Sim must be in the social group before they will consider changing postures.
